name: hacky
content:
hacky adjective
(LOW QUALITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
informal (of computer programming) not elegant (= simple in a way that shows skill and care), although it may solve a problem effectively: I just wrote some ugly, hacky code that got the job done. The programming is kind of hacky, but it works.
informal (of a piece of writing or film) not skilful or original: The sitcom is a hacky, cliché-filled mess. The documentary was ill conceived, badly shot and hacky.
More examplesFewer examplesI know this is a hacky, unprofessional way to do it, but I'm the first to admit that I'm not a good programmer.There is a quick way round this (although it's a hacky one).It's easy to come up with a bunch of stupid hacky ideas and throw them on the page.It's a hacky remake of a mediocre 1970s movie.

hacky adjective
(OF COUGH)
(of a cough) loud and sounding painful: The child had a persistent, dry, hacky cough. Synonym
hacking
